text: <a href="../1-Peter-2-1/" title="1 Peter 2:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,
<a href="../1-Peter-2-2/" title="1 Peter 2:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 As newborn babes, desire the sincere milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby:
<a href="../1-Peter-2-3/" title="1 Peter 2:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 If so be ye have tasted that the Lord *is* gracious.
<a href="../1-Peter-2-4/" title="1 Peter 2:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 To whom coming, *as unto* a living stone, disallowed indeed of men, but chosen of God, *and* precious,

<a href="../1-Peter-2-5/" title="1 Peter 2:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-6/" title="1 Peter 2:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Wherefore also it is contained in the scripture, Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-7/" title="1 Peter 2:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Unto you therefore which believe *he is* precious: but unto them which be disobedient, the stone which the builders disallowed, the same is made the head of the corner,

<a href="../1-Peter-2-8/" title="1 Peter 2:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offence, *even to them* which stumble at the word, being disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-9/" title="1 Peter 2:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 But ye *are* a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

<a href="../1-Peter-2-10/" title="1 Peter 2:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Which in time past *were* not a people, but *are* now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-11/" title="1 Peter 2:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Dearly beloved, I beseech *you* as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;

<a href="../1-Peter-2-12/" title="1 Peter 2:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Having your conversation honest among the Gentiles: that, whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may by *your* good works, which they shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-13/" title="1 Peter 2:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;

<a href="../1-Peter-2-14/" title="1 Peter 2:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Or unto governors, as unto them that are sent by him for the punishment of evildoers, and for the praise of them that do well.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-15/" title="1 Peter 2:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 For so is the will of God, that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:
<a href="../1-Peter-2-16/" title="1 Peter 2:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 As free, and not using *your* liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.
<a href="../1-Peter-2-17/" title="1 Peter 2:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Honour all *men*. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-18/" title="1 Peter 2:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Servants, *be* subject to *your* masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.
<a href="../1-Peter-2-19/" title="1 Peter 2:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 For this *is* thankworthy, if a man for conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-20/" title="1 Peter 2:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 For what glory *is it*, if, when ye be buffeted for your faults, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer *for it*, ye take it patiently, this *is* acceptable with God.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-21/" title="1 Peter 2:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 For even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps:
<a href="../1-Peter-2-22/" title="1 Peter 2:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:

<a href="../1-Peter-2-23/" title="1 Peter 2:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, he threatened not; but committed *himself* to him that judgeth righteously:

<a href="../1-Peter-2-24/" title="1 Peter 2:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripes ye were healed.

<a href="../1-Peter-2-25/" title="1 Peter 2:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 For ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.
